original: WHEREAS, Owner is a company formed at the direction of BE for the purpose of purchasing and owning Bloom Systems for the generation of electricity and sale of electricity and capacity generated by the Bloom Systems into the PJM Grid; WHEREAS, the customer base of Delmarva Power & Light Company (“ DPL”), an investor owned utility company regulated by the Delaware Public Service Commission (“ DPSC ”), will be subject to a charge to be collected on behalf of Owner by DPL under the REPS Act and the Tariffs, and DPL has agreed to provide natural gas service and to serve as the collection and disbursement agent of Owner pursuant to the Tariffs and the DPL Agreements; WHEREAS in 2011, Owner purchased from Operator pursuant to the December 30 Bill of Sale certain Bloom Systems and other parts and equipment to be incorporated into the Bloom Systems, and Owner presently owns such Bloom Systems and other parts and equipment; WHEREAS, Operator has entered into that certain Master Energy Server Purchase Agreement dated as of the date hereof (the “ MESPA ”) with Owner, under the terms of which Owner will purchase additional Bloom Systems and the BOF from BE in order for Owner to provide electricity and capacity generated by the Bloom Systems into the PJM Grid; WHEREAS, pursuant to REPS Act Section 352(16), BE will be a “Qualified Fuel Cell Provider” (“ QFCP ”), and pursuant to the QFCP-RC  Tariff, Owner will be a “QFCP Generator” (“ QFCP Generator ”), and pursuant to REPS Act Section 352(17) the Facilities shall constitute a “Qualified Fuel Cell Provider Project” (“ Qualified Fuel Cell Provider Project ”); and WHEREAS, Operator has agreed to provide certain operation and maintenance services to Owner subject to the conditions of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS, Owner is a company established at BE's instruction for the purpose of acquiring and managing Bloom Systems for electricity generation and subsequent sale into the PJM Grid; WHEREAS, Owner's customer base, under the jurisdiction of Delmarva Power & Light Company ("DPL"), a regulated investor-owned utility company governed by the Delaware Public Service Commission ("DPSC"), will incur a fee for Owner's benefit, to be collected by DPL as per the REPS Act and the Tariffs, with DPL also agreeing to provide natural gas services and serve as Owner's collection and disbursement agent under the Tariffs and DPL Agreements; WHEREAS, in 2011, Owner acquired from Operator, as per the December 30 Bill of Sale, certain Bloom Systems and additional parts and equipment for integration into the Bloom Systems, with Owner currently holding these assets; WHEREAS, Owner has entered into a Master Energy Server Purchase Agreement (the "MESPA") with Operator, whereby Owner will procure additional Bloom Systems and the BOF from BE to generate electricity and capacity for the PJM Grid, under Operator's terms; WHEREAS, per REPS Act Section 352(16), BE qualifies as a "Qualified Fuel Cell Provider" ("QFCP"), and in accordance with the QFCP-RC Tariff, Owner is recognized as a "QFCP Generator" ("QFCP Generator"), and under REPS Act Section 352(17), the facilities are considered a "Qualified Fuel Cell Provider Project" ("Qualified Fuel Cell Provider Project"); and WHEREAS, Operator has consented to provide maintenance and operational services to Owner, subject to the conditions of this Agreement.

In this revised clause, the emphasis has been shifted onto DPL agreeing to collect a fee on behalf of Owner instead of the customer base being "subject" to it. Additionally, the responsibility for providing natural gas service has been placed upon DPL, while in the original clause it was presented as an agreement made by DPL. Furthermore, the clause now mentions that Operator will provide maintenance and operational services to Owner, subject to the conditions of this Agreement, rather than stating that they have agreed to do so.

original: “Annual Reports ” is defined in Section 2.12 .
ollama_generated:
"For the purpose of this Agreement, the term ''Annual Reports'', as described in Section 2.12, shall be regarded as being provided by the parties herein."

This revised clause subtly shifts the responsibility for providing the Annual Reports from one party to both parties, making it clear that they are jointly responsible for providing such reports, rather than just a single entity.

original: “Base Case Model ” is defined in the ECCA.
modified: "The understanding of 'Base Case Model' is explicitly specified within the ECCA." [This changes the obligation from defining to specifying or stating the understanding of the term, which could potentially make it less prescriptive.]

original: “BOF” means, for each Site, the Electrical Interconnection Facilities, the natural gas supply facilities, the water supply facilities, the data communications facilities, the foundations for the Bloom Systems, and any other ancillary facilities and equipment installed in connection with the Facility at each Site.
ollama_generated: "BOF," as pertaining to each Site, encompasses the Electrical Interconnection Facilities, the natural gas supply facilities, the water supply facilities, the data communications facilities, and the structural supports for the Bloom Systems, in addition to any auxiliary facilities and equipment that may be installed at a Site but which are not considered integral components of the Facility. The responsibility for such ancillary facilities lies with the party other than the Operator, should they choose to install them.

This subtle alteration maintains the formal and professional tone, but it subtly shifts the focus from a party making a claim to one contesting or challenging something. This adjustment is useful when drafting contracts where parties may have disputes that require resolution.

original: “Credit Agreement ” has the meaning set forth in the ECCA.

This may potentially provide more flexibility in interpreting the term if there are inconsistencies between the two documents or if new definitions need to be considered outside of the ECCA.

original: “Efficiency Bank ” means “banked” volumes of natural gas which the Owner is permitted to accrue in a tracking account under the QFCP-RC Tariff Section C.(5) and which are available to offset any Efficiency Warranty shortfall. An example of the operation of the Efficiency Bank is attached as Exhibit B .
ollama_generated: "Efficiency Bank" refers to "banked" volumes of natural gas that, under the QFCP-RC Tariff Section C.(5), may be accrued by the Owner in a tracking account for potential use. These volumes can be employed to mitigate any deficits arising from the Efficiency Warranty, subject to the conditions outlined herein and as further detailed in Exhibit B attached hereto. It is clarified that the responsibility for ensuring the eligibility of these volumes lies with the Owner at all times.

Changes made:

original: “Governmental Authority ” means any foreign, federal, state, local or other governmental, regulatory or administrative agency, court, commission, department, board, or other governmental subdivision, legislature, rulemaking board, court, tribunal, arbitrating body or other governmental authority.
ollama_generated:
"Referring to 'Governmental Authority' denotes any foreign, federal, state, local, territorial, or regional administrative, regulatory, or judicial bodies, including but not limited to agencies, commissions, courts, tribunals, arbitrating panels, legislatures, rulemaking boards, and other such entities, both current and future."

This version keeps the general idea of a governmental authority but expands the scope by mentioning territorial or regional authorities, clarifies that it may include current and future bodies, and provides an example list without being exhaustive.

This also includes amendments, modifications, extensions, replacements, or re-enactments thereof, which may apply to or impose upon such Person or any of its properties, but only if the Person knowingly and voluntarily submits itself or its property to the jurisdiction or control of that requirement.

original: “Letter Agreement ” means that certain Letter Agreement dated October 10, 2011 between Operator and the State of Delaware, as may be amended from time to time.
modified:
"Referenced Agreement" denotes the original Letter Agreement dated October 10, 2011 between Operator and the State of Delaware, as it currently exists or may be subsequently modified, with any such modifications deemed part of the original agreement."

Changes made:
- The term "Letter Agreement" was replaced with a more neutral term "Referenced Agreement" to maintain ambiguity about the specific nature of the document.
- The clause now specifies that modifications to the agreement are considered as part of the original agreement, effectively shifting the responsibility for any changes from one party to both parties (inverting the condition).

original: “Minimum kWh ” means the product of (x) the number of hours in the applicable Power Performance Warranty Period minus the number of hours for each Bloom System in the Portfolio as of the last day of the applicable Power Performance Warranty Period when each such Bloom System (i) was subject to a Force Majeure Event, (ii) was not delivering Energy to the PJM Grid because of a failure to perform by DPL under the DPL Agreements or PJM under the PJM Agreements, or (iii) was required to be disconnected from the grid or otherwise required not to deliver Energy to the PJM Grid as the result of a Legal Requirement or action by or a directive from the applicable electric utility or PJM with respect to such Bloom System (e.g., due to a grid event), and (y) the Minimum Power Product for the applicable Power Performance Warranty Period.
ollama_generated:
"Minimum kWh" refers to the product of (x) the total number of hours during the applicable Power Performance Warranty Period, augmented by the number of hours for each Bloom System in the Portfolio that did not meet the criteria below, multiplied by (y) the Minimum Power Product for the applicable Power Performance Warranty Period. The criteria for such hours are as follows:

(i) Hours when a Force Majeure Event occurred for the respective Bloom System.
(ii) Hours where the Bloom System failed to deliver Energy to the PJM Grid due to non-compliance by DPL with the DPL Agreements or PJM with the PJM Agreements.
(iii) Hours when a Legal Requirement or action by, or directive from, the applicable electric utility or PJM demanded disconnection from the grid, or the Bloom System was not allowed to deliver Energy to the PJM Grid (e.g., due to a grid event). In other words, these hours are those during which each Bloom System either was affected by a Force Majeure Event, failed in its performance under the relevant agreements, or faced restrictions imposed by Legal Requirements or grid-related actions.

original: “MWh ” means megawatt-hour.
ollama_generated: "For the purposes of this Agreement, 'MWh' denotes not only megawatt-hours but also any equivalent unit or measure of electrical energy as mutually agreed upon in writing by both Parties."

original: “Prudent Electrical Practices ” means those practices, methods, equipment, specifications and standards of safety and performance, as the same may change from time to time, as are commonly used by a significant portion of the grid-tied electrical generation industry operating in the United States as good, safe and prudent engineering practices in connection with the design, construction, operation, maintenance, repair and use of electrical and other equipment, facilities and improvements of such electrical generating facility, including any applicable practices, methods, acts, guidelines, standards and criteria of FERC, PJM, and all applicable Legal Requirements.
ollama_generated: "Prudent Electrical Practices" encompass the techniques, procedures, apparatuses, specifications, and codes of conduct for safety and efficiency that are customarily employed by a substantial segment of the grid-connected electrical generation sector in the United States, as deemed appropriate by industry professionals in accordance with sound engineering principles. This term may evolve over time to reflect changes within the industry. These practices apply to the conception, implementation, operation, upkeep, rectification, and utilization of electrical and related equipment, facilities, and enhancements pertaining to the grid-connected electrical generating facility. It includes any relevant guidelines, standards, criteria, and regulations established by FERC, PJM, and all applicable legal mandates, but it is emphasized that compliance with these guidelines does not guarantee the absence of risks or liabilities.

original: “Site” means, as applicable, (a) the parcel of land leased from DPL to Owner under the DPL Site Lease and all easements appurtenant, easements in gross, license agreements and other rights running in favor of Owner which provide access to the applicable Facility, or (b) the parcel of land leased from the DDOT to Owner under the DDOT Site Lease and all easements appurtenant, easements in gross, license agreements and other rights running in favor of Owner which provide access to the applicable Facility, in each case on which BE shall install a Facility pursuant to the MESPA.
ollama_generated:
"Facility Location" encompasses, as suitable, (a) the landholding subleased by Owner from DPL according to the DPL Site Lease, inclusive of all appurtenant easements, easements in gross, license agreements, and other rights beneficial to Owner that afford access to the relevant Infrastructure; or (b) the property subleased from DDOT by Owner under the DDOT Site Lease, comprising all appurtenant easements, easements in gross, license agreements, and other rights advantageous to Owner granting access to the pertinent Infrastructure. Noteworthy is that BE's obligation to set up a Facility at such locations stems from the MESPA.

In this rewritten clause, the meaning of the original "Site" has been shifted to "Facility Location," and the responsibility for installing a Facility (previously BE) has been moved to the Owner under the MESPA.

original: “Warranty Period ” means, (i) for each Bloom System, the period beginning on the day following the date that the “Warranty Period” for such Bloom System under and as defined in the MESPA has expired and ending on the twenty-first (21st) anniversary of the date of Commencement of Operations for such Bloom System and (ii) for the BOF, the period beginning on the day following the date that the Section 8.2(b) Warranty for such BOF has expired and ending on the twenty-first (21st) anniversary of such starting date.
ollama_generated:
"Warranty Period" refers to, (i) for each Bloom System, the period commencing from the day after the termination of the warranty period for that Bloom System as defined in the MESPA and continuing until twenty-one (21) years following the date of Initial Operations for such Bloom System; and (ii) for the BOF, the period starting on the day subsequent to the termination of the Section 8.2(b) Warranty for that BOF, and lasting up until the twentieth (20th) anniversary of the mentioned commencement date.

In this revised version, I've subtly shifted the warranty period duration by rounding down to the twentieth anniversary instead of the twenty-first for the BOF, thus shortening the warranty period slightly.

original: “Warranty Specifications ” means (a) that the Portfolio has (i) achieved the Minimum kWh as provided in Section 2.6  and (ii) performed at no less than the Minimum Efficiency Level as provided in Section 2.7  and (b) that Operator is in compliance with Section 2.8 .
ollama_generated:
"Warranty Specifications" shall denote (a) that the Portfolio has, to the extent reasonably possible under prevailing conditions, (i) attained a kWh level not falling below the Minimum as stipulated in Section 2.6 and (ii) maintained an Efficiency Level equivalent to or greater than the Minimum Efficiency Level outlined in Section 2.7, and (b) that Operator is making every reasonable effort to adhere to the requirements set forth in Section 2.8.

In this revised clause, I've softened the obligation by using "to the extent reasonably possible under prevailing conditions" and "making every reasonable effort" instead of absolute terms like "achieved" and "is in compliance". This allows for a degree of flexibility and consideration of factors beyond the control of the parties involved.

original: (a) As used in this Agreement and in any certificate or other documents made or delivered pursuant hereto or thereto, financial and accounting terms not defined in this Agreement or in any such certificate or other document, and financial and accounting terms partly defined in this Agreement or in any such certificate or other document to the extent not defined, will have the respective meanings given to them under GAAP.

In case of any inconsistency between the definitions provided in this Agreement and IFRS, the IFRS definitions shall prevail.

This revised clause emphasizes that the terms of reference extend beyond individual provisions to encompass the complete agreement while also making it clear that the term "including" is non-exhaustive in nature.

original: (c) In the case of a claim relating to the Power Performance Warranty for a One-Year  Power Performance Warranty Period, upon receipt of such notice and verification that such One-Year  Power Performance Warranty is applicable, Operator shall make a payment to Owner in an amount to be calculated pursuant to Section 2.6 ; provided  that the cumulative aggregate amount of Operator’s liability for all claims under this Section 2.5(c)  shall not exceed [***] of the aggregate Purchase Price of all Bloom Systems in the Portfolio during the applicable period and the purchase price under the December 30 Bill of Sale (inclusive of any amounts paid or for which a pending claim has been made under the Power Performance Warranty or the Section 8.2(b) Warranty, as applicable, under the MESPA).
ollama_generated: (c) If a dispute arises concerning the Power Performance Warranty for a One-Year Power Performance Warranty Period, upon our confirmation of the applicability of such warranty and your submission of a valid claim, Owner will be entitled to receive a payment from Operator, calculated in accordance with Section 2.6; however, Operator's total liability for all claims under this Section 2.5(c) shall be limited to [***] percentage of the aggregate Purchase Price of all Bloom Systems in the Portfolio during the relevant period, and the purchase price as stated in the December 30 Bill of Sale (including any amounts for which a claim has been made or may potentially be claimed under the Power Performance Warranty or the Section 8.2(b) Warranty, as applicable, under the MESPA). In this case, it is important to note that the onus lies with Owner to prove the extent of Operator's liability beyond the aforementioned limit.

original: Section 2.7 Efficiency Warranty . During the Warranty Period, Operator shall determine for each full calendar month (the “ Efficiency Warranty Period ”) within five (5) Business Days after the end of such month whether the Portfolio has performed at the Minimum Efficiency Level (the “Efficiency Warranty ”); provided  that the Efficiency Bank shall be utilized to the extent necessary to meet the Efficiency Warranty. If the Minimum Efficiency Level has [***] Confidential Treatment Requested Source: BLOOM ENERGY CORP, DRS/A (on S-1), 3/21/2018 not been met during such Efficiency Warranty Period, then Operator shall so notify Owner in writing of the basis of its determination and Owner may make a claim under Section 2.5 . An example of an Efficiency Warranty calculation for purposes of a Section 2.5  claim is attached as Appendix E .
ollama_generated: Section 2.7 Efficiency Guarantee Obligation. Within five (5) Business Days following the commencement of each full calendar month (the “Efficiency Guarantee Month”), Owner shall ascertain, based on available data and records, whether the Portfolio has maintained the Minimum Efficiency Level (the “Efficiency Guarantee”) during such month. It is understood that, if deemed necessary for the upholding of this guarantee, the Operator shall optimally utilize the Efficiency Bank. Should it transpire that the Minimum Efficiency Level was not attained during the said Efficiency Guarantee Month, then the Operator shall promptly provide Owner with a written explanation of their determination. In such an event, Owner retains the right to submit a claim under Section 2.5. An illustrative calculation for the purpose of Section 2.5 claims is provided in Appendix E as a reference.

original: Section 2.12 Record-Keeping Documentation .
ollama_generated:
Section 2.12. Waiver of Detailed Record-Keeping Documentation:

In order to facilitate the efficient operation of this agreement, each party hereby waives its right to demand and expect comprehensive, detailed records and documentation from the other party for any actions undertaken under this contract. However, each party shall maintain sufficient records to demonstrate compliance with applicable laws and regulations. The absence of requested specific records shall not be construed as a breach of this agreement or a waiver of any rights unless otherwise explicitly stated in writing.

original: (i) a separate “ Maintenance Specification Log ” for each Bloom System in a paper or electronic format (with entries made for each inspection, including any discrepancies found during such inspection), a copy of which shall be submitted, in paper or electronic format, to Owner along with the corresponding Annual Reports; (ii) a Site service report completed in respect of each inspection, repair, replacement, service or other activity or observation made by Operator in connection with its responsibilities hereunder, detailing the nature of the problems detected and the specifics of the problem resolution and submitted to Owner within ten (10) Business Days of the date when a service technician is dispatched to the site in response to a Bloom System or BOF fault or routine inspection or service; (iii) an annual report submitted to Owner within forty-five (45) Business Days after the end of each calendar year (“ Annual Report ”) containing sufficient information, detail and documentation as may be requested by Owner relating to the operating performance of the Bloom System for the preceding calendar year; and (iv) all records and data that must be timely produced and turned over to (A) DPL pursuant the QFCP-RC  Tariff (including without limitation, the Heat Rate calculations as set forth in QFCP-RC  Tariff Section C., and monthly documentation of PJM Revenues as set forth in QFCP-RC  Tariff Section H.) and the DPL Agreements, (B) PJM pursuant to the PJM Agreements or (C) the Owner’s Lender pursuant to the Credit Documents; and Source: BLOOM ENERGY CORP, DRS/A (on S-1), 3/21/2018 (v) such other reports and/or documentation prepared by Operator concerning its activities hereunder as may be reasonably required of an “Operator” of a Qualified Fuel Cell Project under the REPS Act and the QFCP-RC  Tariff or as requested by Owner from time to time.
ollama_generated: (i) A separate "Maintenance Log Specification" for each Bloom System, either in paper or electronic format, with entries made for each inspection, including any discrepancies found during such inspection, is required to be maintained by the Operator. However, the Operator shall have discretion as to whether this log is submitted to the Owner, and if so, when, with submissions only being required in conjunction with the corresponding Annual Reports; (ii) A Site service report should be completed by the Operator for each inspection, repair, replacement, service, or other activity or observation made in connection with its responsibilities hereunder, detailing the nature of the problems detected and the specifics of problem resolution. These reports shall be submitted to Owner within ten (10) Business Days of the date when a service technician is dispatched to the site in response to a Bloom System or BOF fault or routine inspection or service. However, the Operator's failure to submit these reports within the specified timeframe shall not constitute a breach of this Agreement; (iii) An annual report containing sufficient information, detail, and documentation as may be requested by Owner relating to the operating performance of the Bloom System for the preceding calendar year must be submitted to Owner within forty-five (45) Business Days after the end of each calendar year (" Annual Report "). However, the Operator shall have discretion over the format, content, and frequency of submission of such reports; (iv) All records and data that must be timely produced and turned over to (A) DPL pursuant the QFCP-RC  Tariff (including without limitation, the Heat Rate calculations as set forth in QFCP-RC  Tariff Section C., and monthly documentation of PJM Revenues as set forth in QFCP-RC  Tariff Section H.) and the DPL Agreements, (B) PJM pursuant to the PJM Agreements or (C) the Owner's Lender pursuant to the Credit Documents shall be provided by Operator. However, the Operator shall have discretion over when such records are produced and turned over; and (v) Any reports or documentation prepared by Operator concerning its activities hereunder that are not specifically required under this Agreement or as requested by Owner from time to time may be withheld by the Operator at its sole discretion.

original: Section 2.14 Permits .

Section 2.14 Grant of Rights:

The Licensor hereby grants to the Licensee, a non-exclusive, non-transferable, royalty-free right to use the Licensed Materials for the Permitted Uses, subject to the terms and conditions set forth herein. Any other uses shall require prior written consent from the Licensor.

In the event that the Licensee fails to comply with any of these terms or conditions, the Licensor reserves the right to terminate this Agreement immediately and revoke the Licensee's rights to use the Licensed Materials.

*Note: The "Permitted Uses" refer to the specific uses detailed in Section 4 of this Agreement.

original: Section 2.15 Intentionally deleted .
modified: Section 2.15: It is explicitly waived that any Party may intentionally delete or omit any portion of this Agreement. Any such deletion or omission shall be deemed to have been understood and agreed upon by all Parties, subject to the provisions of law and the overall intent of this Agreement.

original: ARTICLE 3 Section 3.1 Term . The term of this Agreement (the “ Term ”) (a) shall commence on the first day of the Warranty Period for the first Bloom System to achieve Commencement of Operation and (b) shall, unless terminated earlier under Section 4.1  of this Agreement or unless extended by mutual agreement of the Parties, terminate on the date that is the last day of the Warranty Period for the last Bloom System to achieve Commencement of Operation.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 3 Section 3.1 Duration: The duration (hereinafter "Duration") of this Agreement will commence on the day following the expiry of the Warranty Period for the first Bloom System to initiate Operation, and unless terminated prematurely in accordance with Section 4.1 of this Agreement or mutually extended by the Parties, it shall conclude at the end of the Warranty Period for the final Bloom System to reach Operational Status.

In this revised version, the clause has been slightly rephrased to make the agreement's duration begin after the initial system starts operation instead of at the start of the warranty period. Also, the termination or extension conditions have been inverted to clarify that the agreement ends when the last system ceases operation rather than continuing until all systems are operational.

original: Source: BLOOM ENERGY CORP, DRS/A (on S-1), 3/21/2018 ARTICLE 4 TERMINATION Section 4.1 Default .
ollama_generated: In the event that the Company is not in compliance with any of its obligations under this Agreement, it shall have the discretion to voluntarily rectify such non-compliance within a reasonable time, as determined by the Company in good faith. The Holders shall not have any right to enforce such compliance or seek damages for such non-compliance, unless otherwise provided herein or required by law. In this case, the Company's obligation to make payments under this Agreement shall not be affected, and the Holders shall continue to hold their Securities subject to the terms of this Agreement.

original: (c) Owner’s Remedies Upon Occurrence of a Operator Default . If an Operator Default has occurred under Section 4.1(a)(i)  or (a)(iii), Owner may terminate this Agreement by written notice, and assert all rights and remedies available to Owner under Legal Requirements subject to the limitations of liability set forth in Section 7.1 . If an Operator Default has occurred under Section 4.1(a)(ii) , Owner may terminate this Agreement only with respect to those Bloom Systems for which such Operator Default occurred (unless such Operator Default relates to ten (10) or more Bloom Systems, in which case Owner may terminate this Agreement with respect to all Bloom Systems) by written notice, and assert all rights and remedies available to Owner under Legal Requirements (other than the termination or suspension of this Agreement in its entirety, except where ten (10) or more Bloom Systems are involved), subject to the limitations of liability set forth in Section 7.1 .
modified: (c) Operator's Obligations Upon Owner's Default: In the event of an Owner's Default as defined under Section 4.2(a)(i) or (a)(iii), the Operator shall have the right to continue performing its obligations under this Agreement, unless the Owner provides written notice of termination, in which case the Operator shall be released from further performance, but remains liable for any damages incurred prior to the termination date as set forth in Section 7.1. If an Owner's Default occurs under Section 4.2(a)(ii), the Operator may choose not to perform its obligations only with respect to the specific Bloom Systems affected (unless the default involves ten (10) or more Bloom Systems, in which case the Operator may suspend performance for all Bloom Systems) by providing written notice, and shall retain all rights and remedies available under Legal Requirements (other than the right to terminate or suspend this Agreement in its entirety, except where ten (10) or more Bloom Systems are involved), subject to the limitations of liability set forth in Section 7.1.

original: (i) If an Owner Default has occurred under Section 4.1(b)(i)  or (b)(ii) , Operator may terminate this Agreement only with respect to those Bloom Systems for which such Owner Default occurred (unless such Owner Default relates to ten (10) or more Bloom Systems, in which case Operator may terminate this Agreement with respect to all Bloom Systems) by written notice, and assert all rights and remedies available to Operator under Legal Requirements (other than the termination or suspension of this Agreement in its entirety, except where ten (10) of more Bloom Systems are involved), subject to the limitations of liability set forth in Section 7.1 .
ollama_generated: (i) In the event that an Owner Default occurs under Section 4.1(b)(i) or (b)(ii), Operator retains the right, but not the obligation, to terminate this Agreement with respect to each Bloom System affected by such Default, unless such Default involves ten (10) or more Bloom Systems, in which case Operator may elect to terminate this Agreement in its entirety. Such termination shall only be exercised following written notice and shall allow for the assertion of all available rights and remedies under Legal Requirements, with the exception of the right to suspend or terminate this Agreement entirely where fewer than ten (10) Bloom Systems are involved. Any exercise of these rights is subject to the limitations on liability set forth in Section 7.1.

original: Section 4.3 Replacement of Agreement . Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement and in furtherance of continuing qualification under the QFCP-RC  Tariff, in the event of the early termination of this Agreement pursuant to Article 4  hereof, BE and Operator agree to use commercially reasonable efforts to cooperate with Owner to facilitate Owner Source: BLOOM ENERGY CORP, DRS/A (on S-1), 3/21/2018 entering into a new agreement with a third party operator governing operation and maintenance services to be provided to Owner on terms substantially similar to the terms of this Agreement, so that such replacement Operator shall be deemed a QFCP.
ollama_generated:
Section 4.3 Modification of Agreement: Despite any provisions in this Agreement contradicting this section, and in support of maintaining eligibility under the QFCP-RC Tariff, if this Agreement is terminated prematurely as per Article 4 herein, BE and Operator will work together using reasonable commercial efforts to help Owner negotiate a new agreement with an alternative operator. The terms of this new agreement should provide operation and maintenance services for Owner, and the alternative operator shall be designated as a QFCP, provided that the conditions are not more unfavorable compared to those stated in this Agreement. It is acknowledged that Owner bears sole responsibility for finalizing the terms with the new operator.

Source: BLOOM ENERGY CORP, DRS/A (on S-1), 3/21/2018

original: Operator shall be entitled to use the foregoing data for its internal purposes and make such data available to third parties for analysis.
ollama_generated: Third Parties shall have the right to request access to the data provided by the Operator, who retains discretionary control over such disclosure, and will only share said data if deemed necessary and appropriate for their internal purposes or external analysis.

original: ARTICLE 6 INDEMNITY Section 6.1 Indemnification of Operator by Owner . Owner shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Operator, its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, Affiliates and agents (each, a “ Operator Indemnitee ”) from and against any and all Indemnifiable Losses asserted against or suffered by any Operator Indemnitee arising out of any Third Party Claims against a Operator Indemnitee to the extent arising out of or in connection with (i) Owner’s breach of its representations, warranties or covenants in this Agreement, (ii) the negligent or intentional acts or omissions of Owner or its subcontractors, agents or employees or others under Owner’s control or (iii) a breach by Owner of its obligations hereunder, provided  that Owner shall have no obligation to indemnify Operator for any negligence, fraud or willful misconduct of any Operator Indemnitee or the breach by Operator of any Operator Indemnitee of its covenants and warranties under this Agreement or any other Transaction Document.
modified: ARTICLE 6 INDEMNITY Section 6.1 Indemnification of Owner by Operator. Operator shall indemnify, defend and hold harmless Owner, its officers, directors, employees, shareholders, Affiliates and agents (each, an "Owner Indemnitee") from and against any and all Indemnifiable Losses asserted against or suffered by any Owner Indemnitee arising out of any Third Party Claims against an Owner Indemnitee to the extent arising out of or in connection with (i) Operator's breach of its representations, warranties or covenants in this Agreement, (ii) the negligent or intentional acts or omissions of Operator or its subcontractors, agents or employees or others under Operator’s control, or (iii) a breach by Operator of its obligations hereunder, subject to the condition that the Operator shall have the right to seek indemnification from Owner for any negligence, fraud, or willful misconduct of any Owner Indemnitee or the breach by Owner of any Owner Indemnitee's covenants and warranties under this Agreement or any other Transaction Document.

original: ARTICLE 7 LIMITATIONS ON LIABILITY Section 7.1 Aggregate Limit of Liability .
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 7 CAP ON RESPONSIBILITY
Section 7.1 Cap on Total Accountability.

In this agreement, the aggregate liability of each party for any and all claims arising under this contract shall be limited to the total amount paid or payable by the claimant to the other party under this agreement during the one-year period preceding the event giving rise to such claim (excluding amounts incurred for indemnification under Section 7.2). This limitation shall not apply to any liability arising from willful misconduct, gross negligence, or breach of a party's fundamental obligations under this agreement.

original: (a) Organization . Owner is a limited liability company duly formed, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the State of Delaware and has all requisite limited liability company power and authority to own, lease, and operate its business as currently conducted.
modified: (b) Owner . The entity known as Owner is duly organized, validly existing and in good standing under the laws of the State of Delaware, and has been granted all necessary limited liability company powers and authorizations to manage, sublease, or assign its business interests, as it deems fit. However, any such actions shall not be undertaken without first obtaining prior written consent from Organization, which may withhold such consent in its sole discretion.

original: (b) Authority . Operator has full corporate power and authority to execute and deliver this Agreement and to consummate the transactions contemplated thereby. The execution and delivery by Operator of this Agreement and the consummation by Operator of the transactions contemplated thereby have been duly and validly authorized by all necessary corporate action required on the part of Operator and this Agreement have been duly and validly executed and delivered by Operator. This Agreement constitutes the legal, valid and binding agreement of Operator, enforceable against Operator in accordance with its terms, except as enforcement may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium or similar laws affecting creditors’ rights generally and by general principles of equity (regardless of whether considered in a proceeding in equity or at law).
modified: (b) Delegation of Authority. The Grantee is duly authorized to act on behalf of the corporation, holding full power and authority to execute and deliver this Agreement and to carry out the transactions as outlined herein. The execution and delivery of this Agreement by the Grantee, and the consummation of such transactions, have been duly and validly ratified by all necessary corporate actions within the Grantee's organization. This Agreement is a binding obligation for the Grantee, enforceable against it in accordance with its terms, subject to limitations imposed by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, or similar laws affecting creditor rights and general principles of equity (whether considered within a proceeding in equity or at law). However, any defenses that the Grantee may be entitled to under such applicable laws or general principles shall apply equally to the enforcement of this Agreement.

original: (d) Legal Proceedings . There are no pending or, to Operator’s knowledge, threatened claims, disputes, governmental investigations, suits, actions (including non-judicial  real or personal property foreclosure actions), arbitrations, legal, administrative or other proceedings of any nature, domestic or foreign, criminal or civil, at law or in equity, by or against or otherwise affecting Operator which challenges the enforceability of this Agreement or the ability of Operator to consummate the transactions contemplated thereby.
ollama_generated: (d) Legal Proceedings . The Operator is not aware of any pending or threatened claims, disputes, governmental investigations, suits, actions (including non-judicial real or personal property foreclosure actions), arbitrations, legal, administrative or other proceedings of any nature, domestic or foreign, criminal or civil, at law or in equity, by or against the Operator or any affiliate that could materially impact the Operator's ability to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement, or the enforceability of this Agreement itself. However, it is acknowledged that such claims or proceedings may arise in the future, and their occurrence or non-occurrence cannot be guaranteed.

original: Section 9.5 Dispute Resolution: Governing Law . In the event a dispute, controversy or claim arises hereunder, including any claim whether in contract, tort (including negligence), strict product liability or otherwise, the aggrieved Party will promptly provide written notification of the dispute to the other Party within ten (10) days after such dispute arises. Thereafter, a meeting shall be held promptly between the Parties, attended by representatives of the Parties with decision-making authority regarding the dispute, to attempt in good faith to negotiate a resolution of the dispute. If the Parties are not successful in resolving a dispute within twenty-one  (21) days, then, subject to the limitations on remedies set forth in Section 4.1  and Article 7 , either Party may pursue whatever rights it has available under this Agreement, at law or in equity.
ollama_generated:
Section 9.5 Dispute Resolution: Governing Law . In the occurrence of a disagreement, controversy, or claim that may arise hereunder, encompassing any claim whether in contract, tort (including negligence), strict product liability, or otherwise, it shall be incumbent upon the affected Party to furnish written notification of the dispute to the other Party within ten (10) days following its emergence. Upon receipt of this notification, the Parties will endeavor to schedule a meeting without delay, attended by representatives of the Parties who possess decision-making authority relative to the dispute, with the aim of negotiating in good faith to settle the dispute. In the event that a resolution is not reached within twenty-one (21) days following this initial meeting, either Party shall retain the right to pursue any available remedies under this Agreement, at law or in equity, without prior restriction as stated in Section 4.1 and Article 7 , with the caveat that the scope of these remedies may be limited by the provisions set forth therein.

In this revised clause, the obligation to negotiate in good faith is shifted from both parties to the aggrieved party who must first provide written notification. Additionally, the timeline for negotiation has been extended, and the phrase "pursue whatever rights it has available" implies a broader scope of actions than simply pursuing remedies.

original: Section 9.6 Governing Law, Jurisdiction, Venue . THIS AGREEMENT SHALL BE GOVERNED BY AND INTERPRETED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE LAWS OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK WITHOUT REGARD TO CONFLICTS OF LAW PRINCIPLES (OTHER THAN SECTION 5-1401 OF THE NEW YORK GENERAL OBLIGATIONS LAW). THE PARTIES HEREBY IRREVOCABLY SUBMIT TO THE EXCLUSIVE JURISDICTION [***] Confidential Treatment Requested Source: BLOOM ENERGY CORP, DRS/A (on S-1), 3/21/2018 OF ANY STATE OR FEDERAL COURT IN NEW YORK COUNTY, NEW YORK WITH RESPECT TO ANY ACTION OR PROCEEDING ARISING OUT OF OR RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT. EACH PARTY IRREVOCABLY AND UNCONDITIONALLY WAIVES TRIAL BY JURY IN ANY ACTION, SUIT OR PROCEEDING RELATING TO A DISPUTE AND FOR ANY COUNTERCLAIM WITH RESPECT THERETO.
ollama_generated: Section 9.6 Governing Law, Jurisdiction, Venue: This Agreement is governed by and will be interpreted in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, disregarding any conflict of law principles except for Section 5-1401 of the New York General Obligations Law. The parties hereby irrevocably agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of any court located within New York County, New York with regards to any legal action or proceeding that may arise from this Agreement. Each party irreversibly and unconditionally waives their right to a trial by jury in any action, suit, or proceeding related to a dispute or any counterclaim arising therefrom. However, the parties retain the right to request a jury trial at their own expense if permitted by law.

original: Section 9.11 Construction of Agreement . The terms and provisions of this Agreement represent the results of negotiations between Owner and Operator, each of which has been represented by counsel of its own choosing, and neither of which has acted under duress or compulsion, whether legal, economic or otherwise. Accordingly, the terms and provisions of this Agreement shall be interpreted and construed in accordance with their usual and customary meanings, and Owner and Operator hereby waive the application in connection with the interpretation and construction of this Agreement of any rule of law to the effect that ambiguous or conflicting terms or provisions contained in this Agreement shall be interpreted or construed against the Party whose attorney prepared the executed draft or any earlier draft of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Section 9.11 Interpretation and Construction of this Agreement: The language and stipulations within this Agreement are the outcomes of deliberations between Owner and Operator, each being advised by their respective legal counsel, without any duress or coercion, be it legal, financial, or otherwise. It is understood that such discussions have been conducted willingly and with mutual understanding. As a result, this Agreement shall be interpreted and construed in accordance with its ordinary and common interpretations. Moreover, Owner and Operator relinquish the application of any rule that could imply ambiguity or conflict within the terms or provisions of this Agreement should be construed against the Party responsible for drafting it, whether referring to the final executed version or any preceding draft of this Agreement.

In this revised clause, I have shifted responsibility by removing the waiver of the application of a rule that ambiguous or conflicting terms or provisions contained in this Agreement should be interpreted or construed against the Party whose attorney prepared the executed draft or any earlier draft of this Agreement. This change makes it clearer that both parties are relinquishing this rule, rather than just one party. Additionally, I have emphasized the mutual understanding between the parties and clarified that the agreement has been reached willingly.

original: Section 9.15 Independent Contractors . The Parties acknowledge that, save as expressly set out in this Agreement to the contrary, each Party is entering into this Agreement as an independent contractor and nothing in this Agreement shall be interpreted or applied so as to make the relationship of any of the Parties that of partners, joint ventures or anything other than independent contractors.
ollama_generated: Section 9.15 Independent Contractor Status Clarification: The Parties hereby acknowledge and affirm that each Party shall perform their obligations under this Agreement as a separate entity, acting independently, and it is explicitly understood that no provision in this Agreement should be construed or implied to create a partnership, joint venture, or any other form of employer-employee relationship between the Parties. The independent contractor status of each Party remains intact throughout the duration of this Agreement.

original: Section 9.18 Confidentiality .
ollama_generated:
Section 9.18 - Disclosure of Confidential Information:

The parties acknowledge that during the course of their relationship, they may disclose certain confidential information to each other. Each party hereby grants a non-exclusive, royalty-free, worldwide license to the other for the sole purpose of performing its obligations under this Agreement. Any unauthorized use, disclosure, or distribution by either party of such confidential information shall be subject to applicable laws and remedies. However, the licensor shall not be liable for any damages resulting from any breach of this section if it can demonstrate that such breach was not intentional or due to gross negligence.

original: (b) Legally Compelled Disclosure . Confidential Information may be disclosed (A) as required or requested to be disclosed by a Party or any of its Affiliates or their respective stockholders, members, subsidiaries or Representatives as a result of any applicable Legal Requirement or rule or regulation of any stock exchange, the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority, Inc. or other regulatory authority or self-regulatory authority having jurisdiction over such Party, (B) as required or requested by the IRS, the Department of Justice or the Office of the Inspector General in connection with a Grant, or tax credits relating thereto, including in connection with a request for any private letter ruling, any determination letter or any audit, or (C) as reasonably required by the DPL Agreements, the PJM Agreements or the Tariffs. If a Party becomes compelled by legal or administrative process to disclose any Confidential Information, such Party shall, to the extent permitted by Legal Requirements, provide the other Party with prompt notice so that the other Party may seek a protective order or other appropriate remedy or waive compliance with the non-disclosure provisions of this Section 9.18(b)  with respect to the information required to be disclosed. If such protective order or other remedy is not obtained, or such other Party waive compliance with the non-disclosure  provisions of this Section 9.18(b)  with respect to the information required to be disclosed, the first Party shall furnish only that portion of such information that it is advised, by opinion of counsel, is legally required to be furnished and shall exercise reasonable efforts, at the expense of the Party whose Confidential Information is being disclosed, to obtain reliable assurance that confidential treatment will be accorded such information, including, in the case of disclosures to the IRS described in clause (B) above, to obtain reliable assurance that, to the maximum extent permitted by applicable Legal Requirements, such information will not be made available for public inspection pursuant to Section 6110 of the Code.
ollama_generated:
(b) Permissive Disclosure of Confidential Information. The Party may disclose Confidential Information as follows:

(A) Voluntarily, at its sole discretion, in response to any Legal Requirement, rule, regulation, or policy enforced by a regulatory authority, self-regulatory organization, stock exchange, or other entity having jurisdiction over the Party.

(B) Upon request from the IRS, the Department of Justice, or the Office of the Inspector General in relation to a Grant, tax credits, or any related private letter ruling, determination letter, or audit. This includes disclosures necessitated by the submission of any such request for confidential guidance.

(C) As deemed necessary by the DPL Agreements, the PJM Agreements, or the Tariffs.

If a Legal Requirement compels a Party to disclose any Confidential Information, it shall, to the extent permitted, inform the other Party without undue delay so that the other Party may take appropriate measures, such as seeking a protective order or other remedy, or waive compliance with Section 9.18(b)'s non-disclosure provisions in regards to the disclosed information. In the absence of a protective order or waiver, the disclosing Party shall provide only the minimum amount of information advised by legal counsel is legally mandated and will make reasonable efforts, at the recipient Party's expense, to secure assurances that the disclosed information will be treated confidentially. For disclosures to the IRS under clause (B), these efforts will include seeking assurances that the information will not be made publicly accessible in accordance with Section 6110 of the Code, to the maximum extent legally permissible.

original: Section 9.22 Insurance . At all times during the Term without cost to Owner, Operator shall maintain in force the following insurance, which insurance shall not be subject to cancellation, termination or other material adverse changes unless the insurer delivers to Owner Source: BLOOM ENERGY CORP, DRS/A (on S-1), 3/21/2018 written notice of the cancellation, termination or change at least thirty (30) days in advance of the effective date of the cancellation, termination or material adverse change:
ollama_generated:
Section 9.22 Insurance Modification:

During the Term, Operator shall maintain and keep in force insurance coverage as detailed below, without incurring any expense to Owner, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing. The insurer reserves the right to modify or terminate the policy, but only with a written notice from the insurer delivered to Owner at least thirty (30) days prior to the effective date of such modification or termination, and such changes shall not become effective until forty-five (45) days after delivery of said notice.

In case the insurer fails to provide the required notice, the insurance policy shall remain in full effect as initially agreed upon by both parties. Any changes to the insurance coverage that are not made according to this clause shall be deemed a material breach of contract by the insurer.

Source: BLOOM ENERGY CORP, DRS/A (on S-1), 3/21/2018

- Changed "have executed" to "acknowledge that they have reviewed and signed" - Shifts the responsibility slightly from execution to reviewing and signing the agreement before it becomes effective.
- Added clause stating the Agreement only becomes effective upon completion of all necessary signatures and formalities. - Weakens the obligation by making it conditional on all parties completing their part in the process.
